item.title: Reclaiming A Caterpillar D10 Dozer's Push Arm
item.description: The team restores a worn push arm from a Caterpillar D10 dozer, rebuilding key surfaces and ensuring the component is ready for heavy-duty work again.

media:content.media:title: Reclaiming A Caterpillar D10 Dozer's Push Arm
media:content.media:description: The team restores a worn push arm from a Caterpillar D10 dozer, rebuilding key surfaces and ensuring the component is ready for heavy-duty work again.

item.title: This might be Homey's favorite toy!
item.description: Homey gets his paws on a new workshop toy, and his excitement makes it clear this might be his new all-time favorite.

item.title: Our Very Own Pair Of V-Blocks!
item.description: The team machines a custom set of V-blocks in the workshop, showing each step from cutting to finishing to create precise, reliable tooling for future projects.

item.title: Line Boring & Bore Welding a CAT 789 Suspension Part
item.description: The team restores a worn CAT 789 suspension component using line boring and bore welding techniques, ensuring the part is rebuilt to precise specifications for heavy-duty performance.

item.title: Winch teardown struggle on the Franna crane project
item.description: The team works through a difficult winch teardown on the Franna crane, dealing with seized parts and tight components to move the repair forward.

item.title: New Trunnion for the Big D11T Bulldozer!
item.description: A worn trunnion from a D11T bulldozer is replaced with a newly machined part, showing the precision and heavy-duty work required to restore the machine.

item.title: Fixing The Side Arm Of A Bulldozer
item.description: The team repairs a damaged bulldozer side arm, cutting, welding, and machining the components to get the machine back into working condition.

item.title: Which tooling do you find most interesting?
item.description: A look around the workshop at various specialty tooling used for machining, repairs, and heavy engineering, highlighting the unique tools that make complex jobs possible.

item.title: This Dozer Is Due for a Full Rebuild
item.description: A closer look at a D10 dozer that’s reached the point where major restoration is needed, from worn components to structural repairs. What would be your first step in a rebuild like this?

item.title: Crafting a Giant Hex Socket
item.description: Watch the step-by-step process of machining an oversized hex socket, from shaping the metal to achieving a precise final fit. What would you build with a tool like this?

item.title: Machining & Welding: Fixing a Cylinder Barrel
item.description: Watch the combined precision of machining and welding as a damaged cylinder barrel is restored step by step. What aspect of the repair interests you most?

item.title: Building a Fume Extraction System for Metal Arc Spraying
item.description: See how a custom fume extraction setup is designed and built to keep metal arc spraying cleaner and safer. Which part of the build stands out to you?

item.title: Making a New Cylinder Nut: Step by Step
item.description: Follow the machining process to create a fresh cylinder nut, highlighting careful cuts, measurements, and finishing. What part of the build caught your attention?

item.title: From Scratch: Building an Excavator H-Link
item.description: Watch the full fabrication of a new H-Link, from raw material to finished part, showcasing precision and heavy-equipment craftsmanship. Which step would you try yourself?

item.title: Letting Go of the Big Horizontal Mill
item.description: Watch the process of removing a large horizontal milling machine and making space for what comes next in the shop. What would you replace it with?

item.title: Testing the Vertex Super Indexing Head
item.description: Watch the assembly, setup, and precision testing of the Vertex Super Indexing Head as it’s put through its paces. Which feature of this tool stands out to you?

item.title: We Didn’t Expect to Find This: Franna Crane Engine Teardown
item.description: A detailed look inside a Franna crane engine reveals unexpected findings during a full teardown. What do you think surprised the team the most?

item.title: Cracked End on an Equalizer Bar Needs Replacement
item.description: See how a damaged equalizer bar is safely removed and rebuilt to restore proper function. What step do you think is the most critical in a job like this?

item.title: Crack Repair: Double-Acting Telescopic Cylinder
item.description: A detailed look at repairing a cracked telescopic cylinder through careful machining and skilled technique. What part of the repair process interests you most?

item.title: Machining This Shaft Didn’t Go According to Plan
item.description: A routine shaft job takes an unexpected turn, highlighting the value of technique and troubleshooting in the shop. How would you handle a mid-project surprise?
